intro: Corispermum elongatum var. latifolium, commonly known as the broad-leafed corispermum, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically broad and succulent, adapted to store water in harsh environments. It is often found in sandy soils and is a common species in desert ecosystems.
